definition: (Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
pier foundation (architecture)/(Tw) politically influential figure enlisted to support one side in an election
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
Su Tseng-chang (1947-), Taiwanese DPP politician, premier of the Republic of China (2019-)
highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to share the booty/to divide ill-gotten gains
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
